file_content.text: If we need anything further, we will have General Garza contact you.
Lieutenant, make yourself comfortable. On behalf of the Senate of the Galactic Republic, I want to thank you for appearing on such short notice for this informal inquiry.
I'm at your service, Senators.
It's an honor to be here.
Just doing my duty, sir.
No problem.
You think I'd be here if I had any say in the matter?
Like I had a choice.
I assure you we will not hold you from your duties any longer than necessary, Lieutenant.
The purpose of this inquiry is to investigate the defection of several members of Republic Army Special Forces squad number 326, code named "Havoc Squad," to the Sith Empire.
Now, you recently served in Havoc Squad on Ord Mantell, Lieutenant. Is that correct?
That's right, Senator.
Correct.
I have no recollection of that.
I don't remember.
Don't play games with us, Lieutenant. This is a serious situation, and your cooperation is required by law.
We understand that your work requires a degree of secrecy, and I assure you nothing you say will leave this room. So please, answer truthfully.
You already know the answer. What are you asking me for?
Don't waste my time.
It's a simple question, Lieutenant. Your hostility is unwarranted.
While serving on Ord Mantell, all of the members of Havoc Squad, excluding yourself, defected to the Sith Empire. Is that correct?
I do not recall the events you describe, Senator.
I'm unaware of any defections.
Is that so? Our sources tell us that not only were you present at the time of the defections, you were, in fact, the one who discovered them!
General Vander's reports on the incident were frustratingly vague--and you, apparently, share his need to conceal the truth!
Yes, Senator, my squad defected right in front of me.
That is correct, sir.
If you're looking to make a point here, just say it.
What are you trying to say?
Lieutenant, you are a soldier of the Republic and sworn to obey the commands of the Senate.
Please, we're only trying to discover the truth. If critical members of the Republic armed forces have defected, we'll need to take proper precautions.
Now, did Commander Tavus or any of the other members of Havoc Squad show signs of, say... instability? Anger? Frustration?
I don't believe there were any such signs, Senator.
No, sir, none at all.
Yes, they were all pretty off-balance.
They did, sir.
I'm afraid I don't know the people you're referring to all that closely, sir.
I don't really know.
Lieutenant! You are lying to the Senate of the Galactic Republic!
Please, no one wants this to turn into a full-blown investigation. If you just answer honestly now, we can avoid all of that.
Lieutenant, let us speak hypothetically: Do you believe that anyone serving on Ord Mantell should have seen this situation coming?
I'm sorry, I'm not sure I know what you're referring to.
What situation?
He refers to the situation in which your entire squad defected to the Sith Empire, and then you failed to aid a Senate investigation into the matter!
If we don't receive satisfactory answers now, we'll have no choice but to open a formal investigation.
I don't think anyone could have seen this coming, sir.
No one could've predicted it.
Commander Tavus and the others must have been quite subtle indeed.
Sergeant Jorgan worked closely with everyone. He should've known.
Aric Jorgan.
You son of a--
We have not asked for your input at this time, Sergeant Jorgan. Please remain silent.
Yes, I see here that the man was demoted for his involvement in the incident... then placed under your own command? That's highly unusual.
I have one final question, Lieutenant: What connection, if any, exists between the events that occurred on Ando Prime and Havoc Squad's decision to defect to--
Senator, I would remind you that the circumstances of Ando Prime are classified and occurred before the lieutenant's involvement in Havoc Squad. You may ignore that question, Lieutenant.
As you wish, Senator.
Very well.
Tavus said the Republic left Havoc to die on Ando Prime. Is that true?
Ando Prime started everything.
As I said, Lieutenant, that subject is classified. You needn't trouble yourself about it.
Can I go now?
Your part in this inquiry is concluded. You may return to your duties now.
Goodbye, Lieutenant.
We did not summon you here. You should leave.
